confirmed_facts: Fire broke out at 14:50 local time on 26 November 2025 in a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Taiâ€¯Po, Hongâ€¯Kong.
At least 13 people died, including one firefighter, and about 10 people were injured.
The complex had 2,000 units and housed roughly 4,800 residents; 7 of 8 blocks were engulfed.
Bamboo scaffolding used for maintenance work was present and contributed to the fireâ€™s spread.
Firefighters classified the blaze as a 5â€‘level (maximum) fire and are still conducting rescue operations.
No Korean nationals were reported among the victims.
